description: From Middle English *adoren, aouren, from Old French adorer, aorer, from Latin adōrō (“I pray to”), from ad (“to”) + ōrō (“I speak”).

verbs.description: adore (third-person singular simple present adores, present participle adoring, simple past and past participle adored)

examples: [James] was met at the castle-gate by a procession of  […]  bishops and priests in their pontificals, bearing the host, which he publicly adored.

entries.meaning: To love with one's entire heart and soul; regard with deep respect and affection.
examples: It is obvious to everyone that Gerry adores Heather.
